abstract: Exxon argued that given the $3.5 billion it has paid in cleanup costs, fines and settlements after the Valdez oil spill, the $2.5 billion in punitive damages is beyond constitutional due process.
snippet: Exxon argued that given the $3.5 billion it has paid in cleanup costs, fines and settlements after the Valdez oil spill, the $2.5 billion in punitive damages is beyond constitutional due process.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 29 — Nearly 19 years after the tanker Exxon Valdez spilled 11 million gallons of crude oil into Prince William Sound in Alaska, the Supreme Court agreed on Monday to hear Exxon Mobil’s challenge to the $2.5 billion in punitive damages that the company was ordered to pay to thousands of fishermen, landowners and businesses.

headline.main: Justices to Hear Exxon’s Challenge to Punitive Damages
